p: SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 appear to use the same cell receptor of ACE2 [ 5], suggesting a similar tropism. However, the novel coronavirus seems to spread much more efficiently based on the number of cases and the speed at which they have emerged. Proteolytic cleavage sites, such as a furin site in the spike protein of SARS-CoV-2, might influence this.
